docs.title: Documentation project
docs.text: Here are records of changes made to the school CMS.

docs.title: How to require hkuportal for admin login
docs.text:
1. Edit html/theorigo/application/config/theorigo.php, go to section ### Config for LDAP
  2. Uncomment define('CAS_LOGIN', 'defined'); to use hkuportal login.
  3. Set host to hkuportal.hku.hk
  4. Comment out # define('CAS_LOGIN', 'defined'); to turn off hkuportal login.
Edit html/theorigo/application/config/theorigo.php to use hkuportal login for admin
### Config for LDAP
define('CAS_LOGIN', 'defined'); /* Uncomment to turn on admin login with hkuportal - Brian added */
$config['cas_login'] = array(
                            'host' => 'hkuportal.hku.hk', /* Brian changed to use hkuportal */
                            'port' => '443',
                            'uri' => '/cas',
                            'change_session_id' => false
                        );

docs.title: Backup/restore mysql databases
docs.text: How to back up and restore mysql databases in School server?

docs.title: mysqldump to backup database to a file
docs.text:
Command: 

mysqldump -u <USERNAME> -p<PASSWORD> --lock-tables=false -q --single-transaction  --extended-insert --disable-keys --flush-privileges --quick --routines --triggers --no-tablespaces --databases <DATABASE> | gzip > DB.sql.gz

Note

Replace <USERNAME>, <PASSWORD>, <DATABASE> with real username, password and database name

  1. sbms web site: username=sbmsnew; database=sbmsnew;
  2. teaching timetable: username=sbms; database=sbms;
  3. equipment list: username=biochem; database=biochem;

  1. backup database sbms (timetable etc) into sbms-DB.sql.gz 

    mysqldump -u sbms -p<PASSWORD> --lock-tables=false -q --single-transaction  --extended-insert --disable-keys --flush-privileges --quick --routines --triggers --no-tablespaces --databases sbms | gzip > sbms-DB.sql.gz

  2. backup database sbmsnew (school web site) into sbmsnew-DB.sql.gz 

    mysqldump -u sbmsnew -p<PASSWORD> --lock-tables=false -q --single-transaction  --extended-insert --disable-keys --flush-privileges --quick --routines --triggers --no-tablespaces --databases sbmsnew | gzip > sbmsnew-DB.sql.gz

  3. backup database biochem (equipment list) into biochem-DB.sql.gz 

    mysqldump -u biochem -p<PASSWORD> --lock-tables=false -q --single-transaction  --extended-insert --disable-keys --flush-privileges --quick --routines --triggers --no-tablespaces --databases biochem | gzip > biochem-DB.sql.gz

docs.title: Restore databases
docs.text:
gunip mysqldump files: 

gunzip sbms-DB.sql.gz
gunzip sbmsnew-DB.sql.gz
gunzip biochem-DB.sql.gz

Log in mysql: 

mysql -u <USERNAME> -p<PASSWORD>
Restore database: 
mysql> use <DATABASE>
mysql> \W
mysql> source <mysqldump_file>
mysql> exit

  1. Restore database sbms (for timetable etc) 

    mysql -u sbms -p<PASSWORD>

    mysql> use sbms
mysql> \W
mysql> source sbms-DB.sql
mysql> exit

  2. Restore database sbmsnew: (for school website etc) 

    mysql -u sbmsnew -p<PASSWORD>

    mysql> use sbmsnew
mysql> \W
mysql> source sbmsnew-DB.sql
mysql> exit

  3. Restore database biochem (for equipment list): 

    mysql -u biochem -p<PASSWORD>

    mysql> use biochem
mysql> \W
mysql> source biochem-DB.sql
mysql> exit

docs.title: Make folder writable by Apache
docs.text:
The ~/html/writables folder in School server needed to be writable by Apache. Use setfacl command to change access control of these folders so Apache can write to these folder. User (sbms) can delete files created by Apache.

Command: 

setfacl -R -m d:u:sbms:rwx,u:sbms:rwx,d:u:apache:rwx,u:apache:rwx <FOLDER>


[sbms@webcloud01 html]$ ls -l
drwxrwxr-x. 12 sbms sbm   4096 Jul 22  2023 writables

Change permissions for html/writables folder to be writable by apache web server 

$ setfacl -R -m d:u:sbms:rwx,u:sbms:rwx,d:u:apache:rwx,u:apache:rwx /disk1/sbm/sbms/html/writables

Check folder permission after setfacl command (note the '+' character after directory listing): 

[sbms@webcloud01 html]$ ls -l
drwxrwxr-x+ 12 sbms sbm   4096 Jul 22  2023 writables

Additional folders may also need to be writable by Apache

Make html/theorigo/application/logs folder writable by Apache if you want to output application log to the default log folder. Alternatively, you can save the application log to ~/html/writables/logs 

/disk1/sbm/sbms/html/theorigo/application/logs

docs.title: How to make text in slider on frontpage clickable
docs.text:
URL for image in "Key Visual" in front page is formatted incorrectly and the title text has no hyperlink. How to fix?

Edit file html/theorigo/application/modules/main/views/index.twig.

  1. Line #9: change from: 
    <a{{ banner['href_target'][0] }}
    to: 
    <a{{ banner['href_target'][0] | raw }} style="text-decoration:none">
  2. Wrap the title text {{ banner['heading'][0] | raw }} (line 16 of original code) with the following code to add hyperlink to title text. style="text-decoration:none" is to remove the underline in hyperlinked text. 
    <a{{ banner['href_target'][0] | raw }}  style="text-decoration:none">

</a>
    Edit html/theorigo/application/modules/main/views/index.twig
    {% extends '@theme/base.twig' %}
{% block content %}
<section class="main-top">
    <div class="slider-wrap">
        <div class="slider slider-hero">
            {%  for banner in banners  %}
            <div class="slider__item slider-hero__item slick-slide">
                <div class="slider-imgC slider-hero__imgC">
                    <a{{ banner['href_target'][0] | raw }} style="text-decoration:none"> <!-- Brian edited -->
                        <img class="hidden-xs"{{ banner['image'][1] | raw }}>
                        <img class="visible-xs"{{ banner['mobile_image'][1] | raw }}>
                    </a>
                </div>
                <div class="slider__content slider-hero__content">
                    <h1 class="slider__heading slider-hero__heading">
                        <a{{ banner['href_target'][0] | raw }}  style="text-decoration:none">  <!-- Brian added, activate link to text -->
                        {{ banner['heading'][0] | raw }}
                        </a> <!-- Brian added -->
                    </h1>
                    <div class="slider__text slider-hero__text">
                        <span>{{ banner['subheading'][0] | raw }}</span>
                    </div>
                </div>
            </div>
            {%  endfor  %}
        </div>
    </div>
</section>
  3. Run clear_all_cache script to refresh: http://www.sbms.hku.hk/clear_all_cache

docs.title: How to include links to social media on page header
docs.text:
Elements in the web page header is described in html/theorigo/application/views/themes/common/header.twig. Edit this file to edit/add/delete elements in the page header.

  1. Edit html/theorigo/application/views/themes/common/header.twig to add social media links edit html/theorigo/application/views/themes/common/header.twig to add social media links
    <div class="menu-top">
    <ul class="menu-top__list">

        <!-- Brian added -->
        <li class="menu-top__item link twitter">
            <a href="https://x.com/hkusbms/" target="_blank">{{ svg_include('twitter') | raw }}</a>
        </li>
        <li class="menu-top__item link instagram">
            <a href="https://www.instagram.com/hkusbms/" target="_blank">{{ svg_include('instagram') | raw }}</a>
        </li>
        <li class="menu-top__item link facebook">
            <a href="https://www.facebook.com/hkusbms" target="_blank">{{ svg_include('facebook') | raw }}</a>
        </li>
        <!-- end Brian added -->

        <li class="menu-top__item link">
            <a href="http://hku.hk" target="_blank">{{ _('HKU Home')  }}</a>
        </li>
        <li class="menu-top__item link">
            <a href="http://med.hku.hk" target="_blank">{{ _('Faculty Home')  }}</a>
        </li>
  2. Edit html/theorigo/application/views/themes/common/header.twig to modify color changes whne hover over social media icons. Add the following lines before the page header. Find fill color and fill-opacity by trial and error. edit html/theorigo/application/views/themes/common/header.twig to modify hover color change
    <!-- Brian added begin -->
<style>
    .facebook:hover svg path,.menu-top__item:focus svg path {
        fill: #3B579D;
        fill-opacity: 0.5;
    }
    .instagram:hover svg path,.menu-top__item:focus svg path {
        /* fill: #c837ab; */
        fill: #3B579D;
        fill-opacity: 0.3;
    }
    .twitter:hover svg path,.menu-top__item:focus svg path {
        fill: #3B579D;
        fill-opacity: 0.5;
    }
</style>
<!-- Brian added end -->
<header class="page-head">

  3. Edit html/theorigo/application/helpers/theorigo_helper.php Find function svg_include($name) { (line #391). Add SVG codes for facebook, instagram and twitter: add SVG codes for facebook, instagram and twitter

    /* Brian added begin*/

"twitter" => '<svg class="svg-twitter" aria-hidden="true" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" shape-rendering="geometricPrecision" text-rendering="geometricPrecision" image-rendering="optimizeQuality" fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" width="30" height="30" viewBox="0 0 512 462.799"><path fill-rule="nonzero" d="M403.229 0h78.506L310.219 196.04 512 462.799H354.002L230.261 301.007 88.669 462.799h-78.56l183.455-209.683L0 0h161.999l111.856 147.88L403.229 0zm-27.556 415.805h43.505L138.363 44.527h-46.68l283.99 371.278z"/></svg>',

    Note

    • Find and download SVG codes from UXWing.com:
      • https://uxwing.com/x-social-media-logo-icon/
      • https://uxwing.com/facebook-round-color-icon/
      • https://uxwing.com/ig-instagram-icon/
    • Add dimensions: add width="30" height="30" before viewBox="min-x min-y width height to specify 30x30 pixels icons. Other combinations may also work.

  4. Run clear_all_cache via http://www.sbms.hku.hk/clear_all_cache or via command line curl -sk -H 'Host: www.sbms.hku.hk' https://127.0.0.1/clear_all_cache to reload.
